reviews.text: London is expensive, but this hotel is a good, clean place to stay in a nice neighborhood. Fairly convenient to the train and the Tube (but we still recommend staying in Bath and taking the train to London rather than the bother and expense of staying in London). Room was a bit tight by US standards, but then again, that's expected in London. We had a nice balcony overlooking the street and the twin proprietors were very helpful. Decent value, standard breakfast fare, and a good place to stay in London.
reviews.title: A Good Value for London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I spent here weekend. Location is simply great with bus line 24 staying just in front of hotel. On the bus route You have everything, from Victoria and Westminster to Trafalgar Square, Leicester Square etc...
reviews.title: Great hotel on great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was very small but exceptionally clean and the staff was very helpful. Bathroom was practically new and very clean.
reviews.title: Good choice for London

reviews.text: My girlfriend is a bit cleaning maniac but she was delighted when she saw hotel and room.
reviews.title: Two thumbs up!!

reviews.text: Breakfast was great!
reviews.title: Very convenient
Luna Simone is lovely
reviews.text: We stayed at the Luna Simone Hotel for four nights in May and found it a very charming hotel. The twin room we had was more than roomy enough for us and our luggage, and was spotlessly clean. There was a closet with room for our luggage and a safe for valuables. The selection of tea with an electric teapot on the desk was a nice touch. The included breakfast was hearty and the breakfast dining area was spotless and nicely decorated. The hotel offered a computer with free internet access for guests. The location within a five minute walk of Victoria Station was very convenient. I would highly recommend the hotel for couples, families, and single travelers. The only downside was the lack of a lift, which made getting to our top floor room with our luggage a very good workout.

reviews.title: Highly recommended
reviews.text: This is a family run hotel where the owners take a real pride in their hotel and with good reason - it is ideal for a short stay in London.

reviews.title: The Positive Reviews are right!
reviews.text: There is no lift, no air conditiong and the Reception is small. The rooms are quite small too but clean, modern and well equipped. I booked five rooms for a group of French visitors and they were all very pleased with the hotel. We were warned about the stairs as some of our rooms were on the top floor but it really wasn't a problem as we did not have large bags.
The owners are very welcoming and helpful, they gave us plenty of advice and we always had the impression that they really cared about their guests and nothing was too much trouble.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: Breakfast is full English, on the first day my wife asked for purnes which they did not have but on the next day they had bought some prunes for us and my wife enjoyed a light breakfast of prunes and yogurt.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel!

reviews.text: I stayed here with my mum at the end of June - we had trouble booking directly with the hotel as it was full but were lucky enough to get a room via Ebookers. I had seen all the great reviews on here and we weren't disappointed!
reviews.title: Lived up to expectations!

likes.liked: — Friendly staff, location, value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As everyone else has said, the room and bathroom were gleaminingly spotless. So was the dining room for breakast, and the food was just right. Not to mention the service! In contrast to the hotel we stayed
reviews.title: Safe, Clean, Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: at the following night in Wembley, the difference in customer service
reviews.title: Good value, clean but small

reviews.text: couldn't be greater - everyone at Luna Simone was so friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Nice hotel
Nice Place
reviews.text: If I'm looking for any negatives, lugging our suitcases up 4 flights was quite an adventure, but I'm sure the owners would have helped us if we'd have asked. Also our room facing the road and there was a fair bit of traffic noise, even overnight.

Family of four-parents and two teenagers-booked with hotel after reading reviews here; we were very pleased with this hotel. We stayed here Dec 07/Jan 08 for four nights in a quad room which had three beds, with two singles for the kids and a large double for parents. Beds were comfortable, and room and bathroom were very clean. Bathroom had very good sized shower, and plenty of hot water.
reviews.title: Great stay at Luna & Simone Hotel

reviews.text: Breakfast was good-basic British egg/bacon/beans/toast and was served hot and fast.
reviews.title: Great place for our group of 9 including kids

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Area around the hotel is nice; found a great pub just down the street. Subway is very convenient, and Victoria station is about a 15 minute walk; if you're flying into Gatwick and are traveling light, take Gatwick Express to Victoria and the subway to Pimlico will get you within a five minute walk of hotel.
reviews.title: great hotel

likes.disliked: — breakfast the 1st of january end at 8.30

reviews.text: Finally, the hotel is directly on the #24 bus route-and this is a fantastic bonus! This bus travels past Westminster Abbey, Big Ben, Parliament, etc-while taking you directly to the West End theatre district. We rode the bus frequently; we enjoyed seeing the sights from the top level of the double-decker bus.
reviews.title: The fantastic Luna & Simone Hotel.

likes.liked: — The cleanliness, the courtesy, the location, the peacefulness of the quarter, the favorable location

reviews.text: We would recommend this hotel to everyone.
reviews.title: A warm friendly and comfortable experience

reviews.text: A very nice little hotel in a good, fairly quiet area. Close to the river, within walking distance of lots of places of interest, and handy for underground, buses and small shops/restaurants. Room cosy, extremely clean, light and well maintained throughout. Friendly, helpful management. Cooked breakfast and tea making facilities in the room is a bonus for a London hotel in this price bracket.
reviews.title: Nice quiet area,

reviews.text: I LOVED THIS HOTEL. My friend and I were staying in London from December 30th, 2007 until January 6th, 2008. One whole week in London. I was very excited when I found this hotel on tripadvisor and with the rating I had HIGH expections and the hotel met everyone of them. I have worked at hotels before so I know what to look for in a clean room and what type of service is expected from hotels and I have to say this hotel is one of the best I have stayed at or worked at. The rooms are CLEAN, a big thing for me. I tired to look for things wrong but its clean. The staff are great. The have breakfast from 7am-8:30am and it was wonderful. If you are a picky eater, talk to the staff and see if you can get something not on the menu. If they have it they are more than willing to give it to you. I loved when they gave me more OJ for breakfast. The front desk is willing to answer any questions and give directions and something my friend and I loved was they have a computer (NOT WIRELESS) but a desktop in a closet room for customers to use. So you have to share it with the entire hotel but my friend and I were always able to get on and be able to email our family back home. Something I loved. Ususally hotels charge a fee for using a computer like I had to do in Edinburgh but no this hotel was free. Computer hours are from 7am until 11pm.
reviews.title: Best Hotel I have ever stayed at!

likes.liked: — Internet, Clean Rooms, Great Staff, Breakfast and Location
likes.disliked: — The people who wont go to sleep and made a lot of noise some nights

reviews.text: I am telling all those people out there if you are looking for a hotel in London go to the Luna and Simone hotel. Great service, clean rooms and being 4-5 minute walk from Victoria Station makes getting around London easy. 20 minute walk to Big Ben, so it was nice for New Years getting back to our hotel. I have read some of the ''Complaints'' that other customers have made about Luna and Simone hotel and 95% of them I could tell our not travelers or they have expections that no hotel can give. Trust me some of the complaints you have to read between the lines and listen to the type of person. This hotel is 5 out of 5 for me and should be higher in ranking of hotel in all of London. Just be careful when you are making your way to the hotel. My friend and I got confused and head the wrong direction because we exited the wrong side of the station and walked around with our heavy bags for awhile.
reviews.title: Loved the hotel

reviews.text: I stayed at a small single room without bath/toilet. Even though I had to share a bathroom, it was very clean and always available because it was shared only between me and a person staying at the next single room. The hotel staff were very helpful and charming. Location was good too. It was close enough to walk from tube, bus stops and Victoria station. I do recommend this hotel to everyone.
reviews.title: We will defnitely return!

reviews.text: We found this hotel on trip advisor, and booked straight away.
reviews.title: Excellent stay!!
Great Place to Stay
reviews.text: Wonderful location, very good value for London, and a very helpful staff.
If cleanliness, convenience and a helpful staff are what you are looking for, consider the Luna!
reviews.title: Totally satisfied with our choice

reviews.text: We stayed at the Luna & Simone for a week in early October '05. We had an extremely quiet (not facing Belgrave Rd.) and clean room. It was very small, but nicely appointed - except for the very hard bed. The bathroom was spotless and had an excellent shower. The staff were all quite friendly and the breakfast was very good. To clear up the earlier controversy about whether it's a full English breakfast or not, you get toast, tea or coffee, your choice of corn flakes or orange juice and (1) eggs, canadian bacon and beans; (2) two eggs or (3) cold tomato and ham. As mentioned previously, there is no elevator. There is high speed internet. The location is fantastic. Interesting, small restaurants abound. The Tate Britain is walking distance. There's a great supermarket halfway to Victoria, which, incidentally, is not the closest Tube station - Pimlico is two blocks away. Also, the #24 bus stops in both directions right outside the hotel. If you're there on a sunny day, try taking this bus all the way to beautiful Hampstead Heath, passing through many tourist attractions and fun neighborhoods on the way. The 24 will also take you within a block of Big Ben, Parliament and Westminster Abbey. It comes about every 5 minutes during the day. Beware - catching it from the immediate vicinity of Victoria back to the hotel is tricky. We'd definitely stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: As Great as all the Reviews Say
Not bad for London & price range
reviews.text: This hotel deserves the enthusiasm of the other reviewers. The hotel was very clean, the staff extremely helpful and attentive, the breakfast good. The rooms were somewhat small, but very comfortable, clean, and attractively furnished. Location was convenient, in a safe neighborhood with reasonably priced restaurants and charming pubs nearby. Close to metro and train station. Would definately return.

Very clean, great breakfast, friendly staff except for the young lad on night shift who was a bit surly. Great location but found room quite noisy from street traffic and adjoining rooms-we were on the second floor facing Belgrave. The only real negative was being told we could not call our own taxi but that the front desk could do it for an exhorbitant fee.
reviews.title: Three star hotel, first class service!

reviews.text: This is a very nice small hotel in an excellent location. The twin room on the main floor was small but adequate. Triple room is much larger if it is available but bathroom is still somewhat small. This place is spotless! Breakfast was juice or cereal, a large quantity of hot toast and jams, ham and a choice of eggs and good hot coffee or tea. Close to lots of restaurants, try Seafresh (Great Eats London) for wonderful fish & chips (10 GBP, about $18.00 US but don't expect any bargains in London). Very helpful staff and 10 minute walk to Victoria Station, my mother and I felt very safe here. Also internet access. I will return.
reviews.title: Great Small Hotel

reviews.text: Very good location,reasonable value,bus,markets,victoria station nearby,pubs .
reviews.title: Good Place Good Value
As expected
reviews.text: very clean,GOOD hosts,great breakfast......I'LL be BACK!!!!

reviews.title: great place to stay
reviews.text: Another nice stay at Luna&Simone. I stayed there with girlfriend in april and decided to stay again, this time with my children. Luna&Simone gave no surprises. Nice clean rooms, personal service and quiet atmosphere.

we recently stayed there for a week and it was a great place to stay. breakfast was good, the owners were extremely nice and helpful. i had to change the reservations about 5 times before we finally got what we needed and they didn't mind at all. i would not hesitate to stay there again.
reviews.title: Most Amazing Value!

reviews.text: WE really enjoyed our 7 night stay at the Luna & Simone. We have only the highest words of praise for every aspect of the hotel. The best part of life is people and that is true of this hotel too----the staff were really friendly and personable---we feel like we have a home away from home and would love to come and stay at the Luna Simone again.
reviews.title: We really felt at home
We had a lovely time
reviews.text: Thank you so much for the lovely time in your hotel. We really enjoyed ourselves. I travelled with my children and grand baby. We now feel like the staff of the hotel are like our extended family. We would never stay anywhere else in London. God bless you all.

We've just returned from a weekend in London, staying for 2 nights at the Luna & Simone Hotel. Like many others, we chose this hotel based on the reviews here. We can only echo the many positive comments already left.
reviews.title: We'll definitely stay again.

reviews.text: In a nutshell, the hotel is:
reviews.title: Agree with most comments but care re:street noise

reviews.text: Great value for money.
reviews.title: Fantastic budget hotel!
Awesome!!! Place to Stay
reviews.text: There were 6 of us fom Canada staying in 3 rooms. We were very impressed by the cleaniness of the rooms and the showers. The rooms are not big but we only slept there and the beds were very comfortable. One of the rooms had a bacony over the entrance and was great place to relax after a day of sight seeing. The free Internet and their breakfast in the morning served by the Twin Brother owners was fantastic!!! the staff was always helpful.We flew into Gatwick took the train to Victoria Station and walked with our luggage to the hotel. the area is safe and a bus stops just a few doors down the street. We would definately recommend this hotel.

reviews.title: it takes years to build a reputation
reviews.text: We made our decision on Luna & Simone after reading the reviews here. Everything turned out pretty much as expected. Apart from the good location, clean room, firm beds, powerful shower, tasty breakfast, friendly service etc., what makes L & S unique is that extra something, tangible or otherwise, that guests have all experienced during their stay. In my opinion, that extra something is the economic moat that keeps the hotel filled and the competitors from getting close.

reviews.title: Great Hotel!!
reviews.text: A successful business is one that gets repeated sales and unqualified referrals. Many thanks to the entire team at L & S for a pleasant stay at your premise. You have got three new supporters here in Greater Vancouver.

reviews.title: Love the Luna and Simone Hotel
reviews.text: p.s. love your Pickwick teas( a blend of quality teas) but couldn't find the same tea bags in all the places we looked in London. Guess we'll have to wait till our next visit to enjoy some.

reviews.title: It takes years to build a reputation
reviews.text: My family stayed at the Luna and Simone hotel for a week-long vacation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I spent 3 nights at Luna & Simone in early Feb '08 and the hotel was perfect for our needs.
reviews.title: Affordable, clean, friendly, central.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were on a budget so to find a well-thought of hotel at this price (£75 per night for double room) and in this location was a real bonus. The hotel itself was perfect. Situated halfway down Belgrave Road, in between Victoria and Pimlico underground stops, it is the perfect base from which to explore London.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great location

likes.disliked: — Small room but such is the norm in London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our double room was of a decent size and included a tv with about a dozen channels. It also had tea-making facilities but no mini-bar. The bathroom was very clean and looked rather new, with the shower always hot. The room was cleaned every morning and fresh sheets and towels supplied.
reviews.title: Great spot!

reviews.text: The very tasty and filling breakfast stops being served at 08:30, which was a tad early but at least it ensured we didn't sleep-in, and with so much to see in the City we couldnt afford to.
reviews.title: We will return to this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is ten minutes walk from the Tate Britain, another 5 from Westminster, London Eye, Westminster Abbey, and only a short skip from there is Tate Modern, MOMI etc etc. And with the underground being so close, expansive and frequent Luna and Simone really is a great place from which to visit further afield attractions.
reviews.title: Not as good as the rating would suggest

reviews.text: I read the negative reviews before going on the trip and I have to say most of them were blown out of proportion or were written by people whose expectations are a bit high for someone trying to stay in a budget hotel in a good location in a big city. The rooms were small but what is to be expected for staying in a large city. (We also weren’t visiting London to sit in our hotel rooms all day.) The bathroom was an adequate size and had excellent water pressure! Our rooms were cleaned daily before we returned from sightseeing. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful- they helped carry my bags up to my room. Also, our rooms were not ready upon arrival so they had them cleaned while we waited in the lobby and chatted with the owners. (this process might have taken 15 minutes). It is true that there is not a lift in the hotel- perhaps this is a lesson to those not accustomed to city traveling- travel light!! I read some reviews about noise from the stairwell- while we did occasionally hear some people in the stairwell it was not sustained noise nor was it very loud so it did not trouble us at all.
reviews.title: Best budget hotel

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Luna & Simone for six days in April 2007 at the end of a transatlantic cruise. I had thoroughly researched hotels in London and decided to try the Luna & Simone based on cost, and the rating and reviews on TripAdvisor.
reviews.title: A remarkable hotel, can't wait to return.

reviews.text: I didn’t totally trust all of the reviews, they sounded too good to be true. Upon checking in I began to discover that the reviews are true. Peter, Mark and Bernard are terrific hosts; the hotel is spotless; the entire staff is courteous and entirely helpful; the breakfast was tasty and a good start for the day; the location is convenient and the neighborhood is beautiful; in summation this hotel is ideal.
reviews.title: Fantastic FInd

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I read several negative remarks on TripAdvisor concerning the Luna & Simone, most appeared to be made by people apparently unfamiliar with hotels in Europe, we had no negative experiences. We intend to visit London again and are looking forward to staying at the Luna & Simone.
reviews.title: good for the money

likes.disliked: — Long climb to the top floor

reviews.text: We won't bother looking anywhere else next time we travel to London...this place has it all. The hotel is located in a clean and safe area and once inside, we felt welcome and comfortable. We arrived at 9:30am and were allowed to check in, but we could not enter the room until 11:30, so they held all of our luggage while we ventured out into the city. We walked the short distance to Buckingham Palace to watch the changing of the guards which was well worth the walk and the wait. Once we got into our room, we slept a few hours before heading back out to grab the 24 bus to the London Eye. The bus stop is literally across the street from the front door and could not have been more convenient. Our room was a triple, one double bed and one twin bed for our teenage daughter, and it was exactly as spotless as everyone has described. We had two great nights' sleep and enjoyed the hot showers in the small but immaculate bathroom. Breakfast was very good and served with a smile. Everyone there was friendly and made us feel welcome. After reading some of the recent reviews, I now realize that there was a computer for guests to use, and I cannot imagine where it was located. Had we known, we certainly would have used it to email family members back home that all was well.
reviews.title: Great budget hotel.

reviews.text: We had an great meal at Grumbles, around the corner from the hotel, as suggested by the hotel staff. Upon checkout, again they held our luggage while we ventured out to collect our rental car.
reviews.title: Liked it a lot!!!!

likes.disliked: — having to leave it, and to leave London

reviews.text: I relied heavily on Trip Advisor reviews in researching/choosing a hotel. The Luna and Simone was one of the few where the accolades were nearly unanimous; I need to add my approbation as well.
reviews.title: Terrific place. Don't hesitate to stay here.
Excellent!!!
reviews.text: While the initial walk from Victoria to the hotel seemed long, it was only because we were finding our way. Once established, it became a very easy, pleasant stroll (10 min tops). And there was always the No. 24 bus to whisk you from the hotel to Victoria Station, Westminister, Traflagar, Leicester Square (PERFECT for theatre purposes) and beyond. The tricky part was finding the bus stop BACK from Victoria Station to the hotel (honestly, it was easier to walk!). Tube service is also extremely convenient from Victoria (3 lines). If you're coming in from Gatwick, this is especially an ideal location.

The room was a very good value for the location, pleasantly (though not opulently) furnished, of decent-size and immaculate; the room's fan was more than adequate during the heat wave we experienced (and I am very sensitive to heat). The breakfast was always fresh and piping hot; and the staff was friendly, courteous and helpful - especially in helping me find a Weight Watchers meeting in a nearby (but rather hidden) garden apartments' community center. Thanks Mark!
reviews.title: Lived up to it's good reviews

reviews.text: I'd wholeheartedly recommend this hotel to anyone and would glady stay at the Luna again.
reviews.title: Great for the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here because of its wonderful reviews. We thought we would never find a hotel in London that wasn't rubbish. Great location within walking distance of Victoria Station and you receive clear instructions with your booking confirmation. There are also a couple of Sainsbury supermarkets close by and a bus stop for the on/off bus tours..near Victoria Station. The room is small but quite suitable for short stays. Great flat screen TV on the wall and the bathroom was very clean. I agree that the breakfast is too early. We had breakfast and then went back to bed.!! Excellent breakfast and they will substitute items if you don't want what they serve. The staff are friendly and helpful and the girls on the desk were great. Looks like you will need to book in advance as when we were there people were ringing and could not get in. The pub recommended by another traveler was excellent. I had the battered fish and chips and my husband had the corned beef. Both were excellent. The staff at the hotel will point you in the right direction. I will be spreading the word about this wonderful hotel. Thanks again guys. (And your first review from New Zealand.!!)
reviews.title: This place is a winner.!!

reviews.text: Excellent, quiet and clean - only place to stay in London. Very convenient location and room was spotless. Slept so well that I missed breakfast on all days I was there. Definitely stay here again and would recommend it to all.
reviews.title: Excellent - only place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only downside were early breakfast (7-8.30am) - way too early for me, and the stairs (no lift)
reviews.title: Perfect Staff, very friendly, great location, great price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In all of our travels over the world my wife and I consider this hotel to have the most friendly staff we have ever encountered. We would eat breakfast there everyday and they knew our preferences by the 2nd day. The hotel was very clean and in a safe area. Although there is no elevator the price and location more than make up for it. Exceeded my expectations. I would highly recommend this hotel and I just hope that giving it a great review doesnt mean it will be full the next time we go to london ;-)
reviews.title: clean and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in this hotel for two nights, room very clean and comfortable. Very friendly and helpful staff. Nice breakfast and convenient location. Would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Outstanding Stay Great Value

reviews.text: Our family of four just returned from London via Gatwick airport and we stayed our last night at the Luna &Simone hotel. It was a simple walk from the hotel to Victoria staton to catch the Gatwick Express which saved us time and lots of money and anxiety getting to the airport. The hotel had lovely rooms at a good price and the service was excellent. The family that runs the hotel was helpful and cheerful and helped us finish our trip to Europe on a high note.
reviews.title: Great Location for travelling to and from Gatwick

reviews.text: Good location near Victoria Station, resturants, and bus lines. Liked the full breakfast that came with the room. Also the free computer station to get internet was nice. Very friendly, helpful staff. The room was small but didn't spend much time in it - and it was quiet.
reviews.title: Good Value
Welcoming Home away From Home
reviews.text: Everything was great from the moment we arrived by underground to the moment we were on the Gattwick Express after a less than 10 minute walk . We left the hotel after 7 in the morning and were able to catch the 7:15 express to the airport.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were welcomed at the front desk and after a last breakfast were personally sent off. If you like _ clean rooms, a fantasic hot breakfast with choices, friendly staff, free internet then this is the place for you! We used both the underground and the bus which stops in front of the hotel and which we were able to catch back whenever it was raining and we didn't want even a short walk from the two underground stations which we used both depending on where we were going that day. We travelled with carry on suitcases with wheels and found going up and down the stairs and travelling by public transport a breeze. We will definitely stay here next time we visit London.
reviews.title: Poetry in motion

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel once again. The same standards of cleanliness and friendliness. Breakfast, as usual, runs like a well oiled machine-poetry in motion. We always use Pimlico station-about 7 minutes away-in preference to Victoria. If you are pulling a suitcase there are convenient ramps at Pimlico and it is a smaller station.(The only one on that line that does not interconnect with anything else.) Make for the Bessborough Road South exit. Close by the hotel there are many local shops and eating places- no need to go far to eat after a long day. Go towards Victoria station a few yards and then turn right down Churton Street, and then left and round the block and back down Denbigh Street. There is even a local market down there.
reviews.title: Book NOW!

reviews.text: The Luna & Simone is a great home base for seeing London. The #24 Bus which takes you all the way to Trafalgar Sq, Westminster Abbey, Big Ben, Victoria Station, etc...is literally right out the front door. The Tube is a 7 minute walk. Plenty of restaurants, shops, and services nearby.
reviews.title: Perfect Home Base For Seeing London

reviews.text: The room we had (a triple) was roomy and super clean and comfy. The staff, everyone, was very very nice and helpful and always smiling. The breakfast was top notch and a relief on the pocketbook is this super expensive city. I will return to the Luna & Simone Hotel.
reviews.title: Very pleased that I chose to stay here

reviews.text: The hotel had created high expectations after reading the reviews posted here, but did not disappoint. The owners were friendly and helpful, cheerful and attentive to the guests. In fact, I arrived very early at 930am after a flight from Singapore and was prepared to leave my bags and explore until after lunch. However, on check-in they said I could get my room keys at 11am.
reviews.title: Great place, wonderful staff, our stay was so enjoyable !!!

reviews.text: The room was a single, rather tiny, but very clean and comfortable with an en-suite. All as described on their website. Even the steep stairs were not a surprise after reading the reviews here on Trip Advisor - maybe a bit inconvenient as I was on the top floor, but nothing that was too bad. The room was cleaned every day which was nice.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in great location and moderately priced

reviews.text: The breakfast on offer was an excellent way to start the day, you just have to be there between 7am and 830am. The Wi-Fi was only available from the ground level or the breakfast room, not the best, but it worked ok. I found my room to be very quiet, no traffic noise at all.
reviews.title: London's lovely Luna
Great stay provides comforts of home!
reviews.text: I stayed at the Luna Simone for more than a few nights. I was young 20 something female travelling alone on a budget, I felt safe in the area, and the Hotel was terrific. I went from a hostel to this so it was a lot more peaceful and clean. I was able to stay in several rooms during my stay, because I did not book in advance, however the staff was always able to place me in another room. I stayed in both the single basic rooms that share a bathroom. These were very comfy! and only 35-40 GBP. I also stayed in a room way up at the top floor, I sure got a work out on the stairs. Once I even was in a large double room facing the front, with ample space and a great view to the street. I felt the bathrooms were always clean, modern and the beds were pretty comfy. The extras such as the in-room safe and the free coffee and tea, the full english breakfast were so worth it, as well as the internet rooms. The staff were super accomodating and I love the fact that the price of the rooms was so low. I felt that you get extremely better quality rooms and service than some of London's other hotels that cost more and are definitly not as nice-- (trust me I stayed at one prior to my european tour- that was provided by the tour group-- and it cost more than triple the price). The nice thing is it is fairly modern, they newly renovated the place and the spectacular area is so close to everything from touristy areas to transportation and grocery and laundry etc. I would walk to Victoria station every day to catch the Underground or walk towards Buckingham Palace to site see. A Laundromat was just around the corner. I would highly reccomend this hotel for travellers on a budget or those who want a practical starting point for their tours of the city so they can be close to the train station, coach station and tube etc. As well as those who want a comfy, inviting stay. My mom and family are going to stay there this summer -and I'm sure they will enjoy their stay! If I someday return to London I will be knocking on Luna Simone's door again for sure!

reviews.title: Excellent value for money
reviews.text: We stayed for three nights in late May. Two adults and a 7yo child. The triple room we had was downstairs and incredibly quiet. Small but very neat and the bathroom, particularly the shower, was wonderful. The staff were really helpful and friendly, breakfast was really satisfying, free access to the internet and all for one of the cheaper prices around. Bus stops straight outside, less than 5 mins one direction to Pimlico Station, less than 10mins the other to Victoria Station.

reviews.title: Fab value, location etc
reviews.text: We were in london for one night last weekend and chose the Luna Simone Hotel from these reviews, and we were not disappointed.

reviews.title: Stayed here twice. Stellar hotel.
reviews.text: Exceptionally clean, welcoming and tidy, modern hotel. Yes the rooms aren't massive but for the price it's nicer than a travelodge with personal touches. The bathroom was very clean with nice fresh towels and a great power shower. Beds were comfy and we had a fan in the room which was much appreciated on a hot evening. Also nice tea and little kettle etc.

reviews.title: Great place
reviews.text: The morning of check out my friend and i were doing a charity run and finished at the time of checkout, however the manager let us have the room for an extra hour so we could shower etc, which was also a very kind and generous touch.

reviews.title: Luna & Simone was lovely!
reviews.text: My wife and stayed at Luna & Simone in London in May (based on the recommendations on this website) and highly recommend staying at this excellent small hotel near Victoria Station. All hotel rooms in London (except the most expensive) are small. That being said, the room was very clean, the bathroom had a fabulous shower, the bed was extremely comfortable (double bed and I'm 6" 3" tall), the room was quite, and the owners were very friendly and accomodating. The price was great for London and everything was quite convenient (a short walk to Victoria Station). Our only comment was the breakfast choices were rather limited (we stayed 5 nights): Orange juice or corn flakes for starters;

tea or coffee; and 3 main choices were bacon, beans, & toast (what no English sausages!); soft boiled egg with toast; or cold ham and a tomato slice. We had a delightful stay and would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Very Accomodating

reviews.text: Great budget hotel. Did not encounter any problems. I am a single female traveler and felt very safe at this location. The staff was very nice and polite-always trying to help. Location is close to the Victoria tube and near supermarkets and various restaurants.
reviews.title: Always good
Would definitely come again!
reviews.text: i have stayed at the luna and simone three times now. it is one of londons hidden gems. my frist visit was on holiday and have stayed twice since on buisness. my boss loves me because i stay here and not in a flash hotel costing mega bucks.

reviews.title: Excellent value for money
reviews.text: it is small modest and above all excellent value for money.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've just returned from London after spending one night at this hotel. The hotel is all that other reviewers say it is but surely we should expect cleanliness, staff who are friendly etc and a decent breakfast in reasonable surroundings?? We, unfortunately, had a room which fronted onto the main street. The noise through the night disturbed our sleep and revellers shouting at 2am was not expected. We had the window open for fresh air as it was a muggy night: there's no air con in the bedroom just a fan. All in all, we enjoyed our stay but I would certainly advise asking for a room at the rear of the hotel.
reviews.title: Noisy but nice

reviews.text: rooms very clean, staff very friendly, breakfast very nice. not much more to say other than try it for youreself. excellent value for money.
reviews.title: excellent value

reviews.text: wonderful location- so close to the city centre yet a peaceful area.
reviews.title: Good Location, friendly staff, inexpensive but small room.

reviews.text: We stayed at the Luna Simone for 2 nights. The hotel is about 8 blocks from Victoria Station and about 5 blocks from Pimlico Tube station. There are many good pubs in the area and a few OK restaurants. The city bus stops directly in front of the hotel. You can use their computer or have free Wifi in your room with your own computer. You just need a code from the desk. We had no complaints and everyone was very helpful. The breakfast had few choices but was acceptable to get you started. I would recommend this place if the price is right. There is no lift so you do need to climb stairs unless you can arrange a main floor rooms.
reviews.title: Comfy beds, friendly staff

reviews.text: I've stayed in a few hotels at this price - the beds are always lumpy or squeaky - But NOT the Luna & Simone, Really comfy bed, really clean, A fan in the bedroom, Lovely Shower room, Helpful Staff, Airy & roomy Dining room, Good Breakfast.
reviews.title: A London Gem!
Consistency, cleanliness, convenience
reviews.text: See below for recent reviews; I won't repeat the same. My daughter and I stayed for 7 nights in May in Luna #2 and were completely satisfied. The correct time for breakfast each day is 7-8:30. We especially liked having both a Sainsbury's and a Tesco market close by. I would stay again if the opportunity ever arises.

reviews.title: A second home... I always go back
reviews.text: I had to make sure I wrote a review about the Luna Simone. I have stayed here about 4 times and each time I have felt so comfortable. This place has everything for the budget traveller (who doesnt want to stay in a dirt pit). The Luna Simone sparkles it is so clean. The bathrooms are absolutely spotless. Sure, there is no lift and your room might be a bit of a trek up the stairs... but the desk staff will go out of their way to take your luggage up for you. That is one of the strengths of this hotel.. the staff. They are some of the friendliest people I have ever met. The brothers and son will do just about anything for you. Once I even asked the son if he could kindly take a photo of my parents and I outside of the hotel and he stood out in traffic to do so!!! The breakfast is delicious as well. Fresh, clean and welcoming. The eggs are great wonderfully served with toast, beans and bacon.

I first stayed at the hotel when I arrived in England alone. Feeling totally out of my element (and showing up soaking wet!) the Luna Simone has always provided for me everything that I needed in London. Thats why I keep going back. I am proud to reccomend this hotel to anyone who wants a reliable, SUPER clean, friendly, comfortable and safe place to stay in London. You won't be sorry.
reviews.title: Great Escape in London
Clean, Modern and Friendly
reviews.text: My husband and I spent the last four nights of our vacation in the Luna hotel. The hotel is in a great neighborhood and is an easy 15 min. walk from Victoria Station. Although our room was up about six flights of stairs and very tiny - it was extremely confortable and very clean. We did not have a problem with street noise and slept great the entire time. I cannot comment on breakfast as it is only served from 7:30-8am and we never made it downstairs in time. However, there are several coffee shops, restaurants and a grocery store nearby as well as a landerette around the corner. The staff was very friendly and helpful with any questions that we had. As crazy and busy as London can be, we found this to be a convenient, safe and clean getaway at a great price.
86 steps to my top floor room. Very small, but clean and comfortable. The owners work very hard for the money. You could only spend more or do worse elsewhere.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a great location
Wonderful experience
reviews.text: I was very pleasantly surprised when I arrived at the hotel. I had booked from the States, via the Internet, basing my choice on the opinions of others at this site. I was more than pleased with the results. The hotel was walking distance from both Victoria train and coach stations, plus a wide variety of attractions. The neighborhood was quiet and well-kept, yet many types of restaurants were nearby. The hotel itself was immaculately clean, and comfortable. The shower was an American's dream, with full force and hot water. For the modest price, a hot breakfast was included, and I did not have to share the bath, as I had on previous occasions at other moderate hotels. The staff, in this family run business, were most helpful and courteous. In short, I highly recommend this hotel and look forward to returning.
We just returned from London, having spent 3 nights at the Luna Simone Hotel. We were pleasantly surprised to find that it lived up to our expectations, and the positive reviews were accurate.
reviews.title: Clean, quiet, convenient hotel for a great price!

reviews.text: The hotel is convenientely located less than 10 minutes to Victoria Station, in a quiet, safe neighborhood that is filled with great restaurants. The hotel is bright and cheerful, and was spotless clean throughout. The staff are friendly and accommodating.
reviews.title: A nice surprise - from my Italian point of view!
You get what you read
reviews.text: Check-in was quick and we were given room #3, on the first floor, toward the back of the hotel, which was what we had requested. The only downside was that the room was at the top of the stairs leading to the breakfast room, so there was noise and footsteps starting at 7:00.

reviews.title: Great stay, kind wonderful family business - like home
reviews.text: Yes, the rooms are small, but we were only there to sleep, so it was adequate for us, with sufficient space for our luggage. Our room was clean, with comfortable twin beds, fresh linens, and new-looking paint on the walls. They even provide extra pillows in the closet. The bathrooms are sparking clean, with new tiles and great showers. Overall, the room is functional, but very basic.

reviews.title: brilliant hotel for a short break!
reviews.text: myself and three of my female university friends went to london for a short break recently and through trip advisor came across the luna simone. We got it for a great price at short notice and we were very pleasantly suprised by the hotel and the people who work there. Very close to Victoria tube station so is ideal for travelling by tube and it was clean, tidy, provided a good service and we felt safe and happy staying there. My only complaint was that the rooms are a little on the small side but who cares when you are only staying there for a few nights especially at such a good price! would definately stay there again.

reviews.title: A great value and location
reviews.text: We've just returned from an extended trip to the UK and Scotland.With one exception(which turned out great) we depended on Trip Advisor reviews to help with our booking decision. A ten minute walk from Victoria Station took us to the front door of the Luna&Simone. As walkers, we were thrilled with this location -the Pimlaco tube stop was not even ten minutes stroll. Towards Victoria Station and Pimlaco we passed large numbers of restaurants and takeouts- great for budget travelers. We spent our money on the theatre each night - the West end is a very short hop on the tube. Our room was modern, very clean and with a nice bathroom w/shower. Our English breakfast was served up each morning by the twin brothers who own the property. Both were just wonderful hosts. The Luna&Simone is definitely going to be our choice for future visits to London.

We stayed at the Luna & Simone hotel for one night and found it to be tremendous value for its location. The room was extremely clean and the owners and staff particularly friendly and helpful. It certainly justified the earlier comments in the reviews we read on this site and would not hesitate to go again.
reviews.title: Tremendous value for its location - clean and friendly
Loved it
reviews.text: It was a great place to stay. The reviews were right on, and I plan on staying there next year again. The owners are twins from Malta, who really made our stay in London easy. Food was great and the location cannot be beat. Place was super clean with brand new bathrooms, and staff very responsive and helpful. Look nowhere else!!!!!!

reviews.title: Kindness and warmth
reviews.text: We arrived in London a day late and in a terrible state having missed flights because of an airline strike. Peter and Bernard were friendly, kind and sympathetic. Their welcome helped get us through the next few difficult days while we re-booked flights home to New Zealand. The hotel itself was comfortable, clean and reasonably priced. It was close to Victoria station and close to the centre of london which was easily accessible by bus. They also provided a great breakfast. Unfortunately our room was noisy being on the street side and I'm sure our hosts would have moved us had we made comment, but we felt that they'd already done quite enough to accommodate us so we didn't mention it.. I would heartily recommend this hotel to all.

reviews.title: A Lucky Experience In London
reviews.text: We were at the Luna Simone Hotel for 1 week, June 23 - July 3.
It was great ! The hosts, Bernard & Peter could not have been nicer or more helpful.
reviews.title: Comfortable and Convenient

reviews.text: The room was clean and fun, the window looked over a courtyard full of other windows and life in London. The bathroom was clean and nice and the shower was big and hot!!
reviews.title: Fabulous!

reviews.text: Breakfast was filling, personally served by the hosts!!
reviews.title: Friendly and clean

reviews.text: The Luna Simone Hotel is extremely well run by very friendly, helpful staff. The room was spot on and really clean with all the facilities you need.
reviews.title: Faultless!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well done to all who work there for creating such an inviting hotel!
reviews.title: Spotless and very friendly staff

reviews.text: I stayed here a couple of weeks ago and the room and bathroom were really clean which is the most important thing! Staff were extremely friendly and helpful. They only negative points were the time breakfast finishes (8.30 am but it was delicious) and the stairs! I would definitely stay here again as it seems to be dependable from other reviewers opinions too. Great Italian restaurant right beside it which makes up for the lack of a restaurant
reviews.title: A pleasure to stay at such a wonderful little hotel

reviews.text: We couldn't believe our luck when we arrived at the Luna & Simone Hotel for our stay in London. It would be hard to beat such a great little hotel. Expertly run by such friendly, welcoming and helpful people who need to be congratulated on such a lovely, comortable and fabulously located place to stay in London. A short walk to both Victoria and Pimlico underground stations and no more than a 20 minute walk to the Palace. We had room No.1 downstairs which was quiet, spotlessly clean and very comfy with plenty of room for the 3 of us. Breakfasts were delicious and filling and served by the two charming hosts in the great little dining room. I cant recommend Luna & Simone Hotel highly enough to any prospective travellers to London who are looking for a clean, comfortable, well located and friendly place to stay. I certainly was a pleasure for us to start out holiday there and would love to return one day.
reviews.title: Holiday bliss to start of holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed at the Luna Simone for years now.Cannot fault them as they are superb.They are like a second family to me in London now.The hotel is spotless,the service from the family is excellent,the room is comfortable & clean & tidy.I have no hesitations in recommending them to anyone as i have done in the past.Long may they continue.Yvonne Cragg
reviews.title: great find in the middle of london

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a fine place to stay, although we got more exercise than we needed with a room on the seventh floor (no lifts). My macho husband wanted to carry the quite heavy bags upstairs; but after I mentioned to Bernard (one of the twin brother managers) that he had quadruple heart surgery, Bernard graciously carried both our bags up the stars as if they were two pillows. Peter, his brother, was also a pleasure to talk to. Did I mention there is free internet? The room was very clean. We will definitely stay there again, although on one of the lower floors. Bacon and beans, anyone?
reviews.title: Great staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want a clean hotel, the Luna Simone hotel is the place to
reviews.title: Cleanest Hotel in town
Clean and caring
reviews.text: stay while in London. Wonderful staff. Breakfast is included, Hair dryer, t.v., phone, tea & coffee in the room. Clean towels every day.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room is cleaned every day. If you use a washcloth, take one with you as well as a regular size bar of soap. They do not provide washcloths
reviews.title: Clean and Pleasant

likes.liked: — What we got for the money
likes.disliked: — Distance from the Tube, but it was on a major bus line

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: and the soap is one of those sample size hand soaps. It is convienent
reviews.title: Great hotel, its all good!

likes.liked: — Location, cleanliness, security and great breakfast
likes.disliked: — No lift (this is the only negative thing about this great hotel)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice reception, helpful staff. Very large room with little garden just out a door. All necessary facilities, bathroom very small though.
reviews.title: Reasonable but not exceptional.

likes.disliked: — noise from stairs etc and distance to tube.

reviews.text: However i wasnt over impressed because we were situated right beside the breakfast area and the stairwell so we got some disturbance from that.
reviews.title: Good value, basic hotel
A wonderful weekend in London ...
reviews.text: other than that not too bad, breakfast was good too.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Little bit of a walk from the nearest tube station.
reviews.title: Great value!

reviews.text: We just returned from a 3 night stay at the Luna Simone hotel. It is excellently priced, and very well located just a few minutes walk from Victoria station. There are a myriad of restaurants/cafes/pubs within a couple of mins walk.
reviews.title: Quite decent as expected
The reviews here are spot on
reviews.text: Based on the many positive reviews here, we booked 3 nights at the Luna Simone. We weren't disappointed. For a "budget" hotel, they do a great job. (80 pounds a night for a double with the current exchange rates may not seem like a budget hotel, but anything under 100 pounds is a budget hotel.) We requested a first floor room for my father-in-law and they came through. We were in room 14 up a few flights of stairs, but we knew this ahead of time and were prepared for it. They do a great job keeping the place clean and the showers/bathrooms were a cut above what you normally find in comparably priced accomodations. The beds were comfortable. Rooms were small, but we weren't there to spread out. Breakfasts were good and the menu was flexible. Free internet was great, but there was usually a queue. Luna Simone is convenient to Victoria Station, which made getting around rather easy. There are also a lot of restaurants within a few blocks. After a long day traipsing around London, it was nice to have dinner nearby. Our room faced Belgrave Road and it could be a bit noisy at times. The first floor room was in the back and was very quiet. I would stay here again.
